column5: This is exactly what we will be doing! The guy in Hayward is salting and freezing them for us in packages of 6!

Hey all, besides the obvious answer that I am a sucker haha, where can I find frozen suckers for my trip to Canada. Somewhere around 8 inches for deadbait pike fishing. Place in ear falls that we get them from isn't open yet. It can be in Canada, ordering online, or on the way up from Chicago. Thank you!
Try harmonbrookfarm.com. Both my brother and I caught pike over 40" with their 9" suckers.
they were my first choice, but they are completely sold out!
Rainy Lake Sports in Ft Francis has em. They also have the frozen ciscos which are killer for pike and walleye.
could try clarke's on cedar lake up the 105. probably have to freeze them yourself though.
Do you have a number for them? I could not find one
I know the Clarke's number for the main camp and outfitting business is 807-227-2154. We will be using them in a few weeks for our fly-in trip.. Really nice folks.
Yup. Toll free is 866-744-2154 or clarksresorts.com
Thank you all for the replies. Ended up finding a whole sale dealer in Hayward, WI that ended up having them and for a good price too! Hayward Bait and Bottle Shoppe!

Hi--there was an excellent article in (I think) the 2014 Fishing Annual published by Ontario Out of Doors, where the author advocated vacuum-sealing suckers in quantities of 4 or 5 and stacking them up in the freezer till needed. I have tried this method with excellent results--you can buy the suckers ahead of time, freeze them, and thaw them as needed. Especially useful when suckers might be hard to find. And especially applicable to suckers, who aren't exactly the hardiest of baits.
